properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-17T06:13:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-16T14:14:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3129377967.2021
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Snow will begin this morning or this afternoon and, combined with strong winds, will give blizzard conditions. Conditions will improve overnight as winds abate. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-17T07:17:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-16T15:18:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3649067640.2021
Area: Inukjuak, Umiujaq, Sanikiluaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. A storm system will bring heavy snow and gusty winds to the South Klondike Highway tonight with near 15 cm expected. Snow and blowing snow should ease to scattered flurries Tuesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-16T16:53:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-16T00:54:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1990092715.2021
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds reaching up to 90 km/h are expected this afternoon and this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-17T07:17:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-16T15:18:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3543613420.2021
Area: Sanikiluaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A frontal system crossing the North Coast is currently bringing snow to the Stewart area. Total snowfall accumulations to 15 to 20 cm is expected through this morning before changing to rain mixed with snow this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-17T00:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-16T09:29:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3888255275.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada
